comments.commentBody: Is it Watergate yet? Is it Russiagate?

You cannot possibly believe that the Wikileaks revelations of democrat emails turned the election, they were petty. Everyone already knew that Mrs Clinton was iffy ethically. Mrs Clinton's email scandal ended with the FBI clearing her, but only for loyal democrats, everyone else had known her level of ethical behavior for many years.
PLEASE let it be that Sessions' lie about Russia during his confirmation hearing is illegal and forces him out!

Kudos to the Times reporters working so diligently! Not just reporting the news. But moderating these ever increasing threads!

Subscribe!

The Russian connection is real. Jill Stein also had contacts with the russians, there is even a picture of her and Flynn sharing table with Putin.Calexit? sponsored by Russia...I don't know what the russian agenda wants but it is clear that they have infiltrated our political system.Be afraid.

This is truly terrifying, that a candidate from either major party would put his self-interest so far out of sync with the national interest that he and his team would blatantly collude with a foreign and HOSTILE nation in order to win.

The only other case was never more than a rumor--that Reagan's team worked with Iran to NOT release the hostages until after Carter was out of office. Never more than intimations and circumstantial evidence. Unlike this.

Now it turns out Senator Sessions, now AG Sessions, flat-out PERJURED himself when, answering Senator Franken's question about his (Sessions') knowledge of contact with Russian officials, denied he had any. Now it turns out that Sessions had 2 contacts himself with the Russian Ambassador!

The Manchurian Candidate was a fictional movie but it's becoming clearer and clearer that Russia has a choke-hold on the Trump administration. Just how far will the GOP let him go before they act? Or, like in other dictatorship takeovers of democracies, will it be too late when they finally act?
Why would Sessions lie during a confirmation hearing?
Now the question is, of course, where does the trail lead? It would appear that the Times has some idea of the answer. Will the facts be deniable by the Trump machine?

replies.commentBody: Not a word you wrote has anything to do with Sessions perhaps perjuring himself, Flynn resigning, or our government having more Russian influence in it than the Soviet Olympians.

replies.commentBody: THANK you! Finally, SOMEONE with some intellectual honesty!

The Times is super careful about checking its sources. Especially in an article as explosive as this.

Doubt the Times, if you like. But those doubts are on extremely shaky ground.

Then again, shakily ground is all you've got! Whereas the Times has got its carefully sourced article. And not just the Times. NBC. Washington Post. It's all over the place now.

comments.commentBody: I understand "three former American officials who requested anonymity" but when combined with "Trump associates" and "Russian officials, some of them within the Kremlin", it hits me that this is a story that (other than the WAPO reporting on Sessions and Kislyak) does not name anybody. At best I want to wait for some identification of person(s) involved. At worst I question whether this should have gone to press. Even to a Clinton and Obama voter, such as myself, this looks like an attempt to derail the positive reviews following Tuesdays speech.

I doubt that Trump's election was directly caused by the Russians, although I'm not convinced it wasn't Russia's desire to do that. I do wonder about the "coincidences" of WikiLeaks and Comey's revelations I also can't help but wonder about the numerous contacts of those connected with the Trump campaign who had contact with Russian government operatives. And now, I wonder about the Republicans in the Senate who are supposed to be investigating this matter. My own Senator Burr is in this up to his neck and has become an apologist for Trump.  I'm just hoping we can find some Republicans with as much courage as Senator Howard Baker.  Doesn't look like it though.
Sessions must go, NOW

Time for a full blown Independent investigation? Seems so!

Obama was notably slow to respond. And the Trump side has been want to see the whole Russian meddling thing just quickly fade.

“…also reflected the sentiment among many (Obama) administration officials that they had not recognized the scale of the Russian campaign until it was too late.”

May be the reason for this was the belief that the hacks and the email leaks would remain relatively inconsequential given the overriding presumption that HR Clinton would most certainly prevail.

Democratic calls for AG Sessions resignation regarding his contacts with the Russian ambassador seem distorted and greatly overblown. At the same time neither side of the isle is anything like unblemished — or unbiased on this crucial issue.

Not enough time to finish the prosecutorial case. Now we will see if Republicans will put the nation before their political party.

President Obama KNEW that the incoming administration was going to try to destroy evidence of their crimes against the United States. Will speaker Ryan and Mitch McConnell help him do it or will they perform their Constitutional responsibility of upholding the integrity of our great nation?

Regardless, Democrats need to win congress in 2018 so a full and complete purge of all those colluding with our enemies can happen.

Nixon said "let the chips fall where they may."
Alright, Congress. Time to do the God fearin American thang. Pull em up by the bootstraps and send a POTUS and a few cabinet members off to 5-10 years of time-out. There there, snowflakes.

This is Nina Castro:

Heroic, especially since he saw that having this successor was like the Titanic hitting an iceberg. So, he helped get the lifeboats ready. If he took personal satisfaction in it, well, that would only be human, since he knows that his "going down with the ship" will never be appreciated by many Americans. And to those who have suggested that he wasn't strong enough in his governance, I'd say, this is a great example of how a thoughtful, methodical, and in this case patriotic, person goes about such things.

This man Jeff Sessions is an American lawyer.  Late American newspaper publisher Edward W. Scripps wrote "The lawyers are known to be liars.  They know they are known to be liars.  They constantly practice faleshood and false pretense.  From among these men we select our judges."  American lawyers also dominate the U.S. Congress and the U.S. judiciary and this is known as the U.S. legal caste.  Scripps also wrote "If there is such a thing as true freedom and democracy then the road to that goal lies over and through the ruin and annihilation of the legal caste."

replies.commentBody: When they actually use something other than "anonymous" sources, and tell us something that isn't "unconfirmed"? It's all there in the article, buried of course...

comments.commentBody: Our Watergate moment has arrived. When will the GOP and their base realize Trump is more than a con man, but an agent for Putin's grandiose ambitions?

Yes, Jeff Sessions needs to step down, but ultimately this falls on Trump.  The source of the "Trump Dossier" (remember that?) is reputedly impeccable. I think we are past the "smoke-stage" and peering into a conflagration.

Trump "associates" could be anything from his garbage man to his next door neighbor and probably are, knowing the way the Times likes to mislead on Trump. Anyone with a lick of sense that has read the NY Times coverage since the election would know that one has to take every word published about Trump in this, so called, news paper with a mountain of salt!

Sessions perjured himself in answering Al Franken's question. It could not be clearer from the tape, and fro his reference to imself as a Trump surrogate.

We need those tax returns. Now. Yesterday.

replies.commentBody: With "anonymous" sources and "unconfirmed" details? No thanks. I'd rather wait for proof than to upend our government based on rumors.

because it is real news showing Democrats doing illegal activities to push a Fake News Narrative.

Thank God Most Americans know the truth.

There is no evidence that Russia directly worked to help Trump. There is no evidence, there never will be evidence, only innuendo.

The NYT's can print 1000 articles like this, all they are confirming is that the Obama administration broke the law, committed treason to push a fake news story.

comments.commentBody: Wow! Why is this not the headline story of the day?  This is one of the biggest news stories in the history of the United States. Top officials of the Republican Party's were colluding with Russians to undermine the democracy of our nation.  Russian operatives no less. On orders from Vladimir Putin.  And the Republican Party smiles and cheers on the leader of this group who did this and seems to be OK with it?  Is treason not treason if a major party is OK with it?
